alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:44PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Henry, northeastern Houston and western Early Counties through 430 PM EDT/330 PM CDT/... At 344 PM EDT/244 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blakely, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Blakely, Headland, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Kinsey, Avon, Newville, Gordon, Haleburg, Saffold, Pansey, Tumbleton, Sigma, Grandberry Crossroads, Enon, Rock Hill, Barber and Pleasant Plains. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
